content: designed by rachel brockman the log cabin blankie is a delight to knit worked modularly and entirely in garter stitch it s the perfect mindless knitting project this blanket is great for little ones knit in our offbeat yarn the easy-care acrylic is blended with a touch of alpaca making the fabric incredibly soft plus the self-striping yarn yields exciting results in this modular design **difficulty** basic **sizes** one size **finished measurements** length 43¼ width 36¾ **materials** **universal yarn** *offbeat* 1 90% acrylic 10% alpaca 150g/586 yds 106 flower power 2 balls 105 dynamite 2 balls needle us size 7 4 5 mm 32 circular or longer to accommodate large number of sts or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle **gauge** 18 sts x 36 row = 4 in garter stitch save time check your gauge **pattern notes** this blanket is knit flat modularly from the center outwards to the edge to easily pick up stitches insert your needle into the outer bumps of each garter ridge we recommend weaving in your ends as you go to save time a visual guide is included to help you best understand the construction 1 https //universalyarn com/products/offbeat
